channel.title: Federate identities :: DevDocs Navigation Menu Test
channel.description: Federate identities Click here to give feedback about this page Group Notes Group description: Federated identity is defined as: Federated identity is a method of linking a user’s identity across multiple separate identity management systems. Federate content includes: Anything regarding syncing users across different systems User authentication using a different system Discuss differences between Outbound Federation and Identity Federation. Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Why is this here?

item.title: Authenticate with an external identity provider (IdP)
item.description: Authenticate with an external identity provider (IdP) Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Changes to be made: The first two sections of the source document are being used in Learn > OIDC > Identity Providers (ID: 784) so this doc starts at “How Okta connects to external IdPs” but requires a new introduction to this group of documents as a whole.

item.title: Define your own scopes, claims, and access policies
item.description: Define your own scopes, claims, and access policies with a custom authorization server Click here to give feedback about this page Group Notes Group description: @Dan Maharry - After our conversation, I lookedup the actual definition for “Identity Federation” and I can see how it relates to Authorization server. Definition: “Identity federation is a system of trust between two parties for the purpose of authenticating users and conveying information needed to authorize their access to resources.
